subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Epic of Gilgamesh: Humanity's First Story
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Epic of Gilgamesh: Humanity's First Story.

hook.text: A king seeks eternal life, fails, and accepts death. The oldest written story taught humanity its hardest lesson.

buildup.text: Gilgamesh, king of Uruk, watches his friend Enkidu die. Grief drives him to search for immortality across the world.

discovery.text: He finds a man who survived a great flood (sound familiar?) and learns that death is unavoidable for mortals.

twist.text: A snake steals the plant of immortality from Gilgamesh. Snakes and lost paradise? Genesis borrowed this blueprint.

climax.text: Gilgamesh returns home, accepts mortality, and builds a lasting city. Meaning is found in legacy, not eternal life.

punchline.text: The oldest story says: accept death and build something that lasts.

quiz.question: What lesson does the Epic of Gilgamesh teach?
options: Accept death and find meaning in what you leave behind
